verses.roman:
śivānande lāthi mārilā,--ihā nā kahilā
ethā saba vaiṣṇava-gaṇa āsiyā mililā

synonyms: śivānande—Śivānanda Sena; lāthi mārilā—(Lord Nityānanda) has kicked; ihā—this; nā kahilā—he did not say; ethā—here; saba—all; vaiṣṇava-gaṇa—devotees; āsiyā—coming; mililā—met.
translation: As he described the Vaiṣṇavas, therefore, he did not mention Lord Nitya-nanda's kicking Śivānanda Sena. Meanwhile, all the devotees arrived and went to meet the Lord.
